alert.note: Alert for Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued May 21 at 7:39PM AKDT until May 21 at 10:00PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Including the following area, Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country. This includes the cities of Tok, Tanacross, Eagle, Tetlin, Northway, Alcan, Chicken, And Boundary. * WHEN...Through Monday morning. * IMPACTS...Excessive snowmelt runoff may result in flooding of low-lying and flood-prone locations. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - An ice jam may cause water to infiltrate the lowlands along the river. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Upper Tanana Valley and the Fortymile Country
